alert.note: Alert for St. Charles; St. John The Baptist (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 27 at 8:39AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, St. Charles and St. John The Baptist. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 837 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Reserve, Laplace, Edgard, Garyville and Wallace. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: St. Charles; St. John The Baptist
